Create a natural cleaning solution using plant-based ingredients: In the absence of commercial cleaning products, individuals could turn to nature for inspiration. Utilizing plants with antibacterial and antiviral properties, such as tea tree oil, lavender oil, and eucalyptus oil, can create a natural cleaning solution that is both effective and safe for use on surfaces. For example, a mixture of equal parts water and tea tree oil can be used to disinfect surfaces, while a solution of equal parts water and lavender oil can be used to clean and deodorize fabrics.

Use vinegar as a multi-purpose cleaning agent: Vinegar is a versatile and natural cleaning agent that can be used to clean and disinfect a variety of surfaces. Its acidity makes it effective at removing dirt and grime, while its antibacterial properties make it ideal for cleaning surfaces that are prone to bacterial growth. To use vinegar as a cleaning agent, simply dilute it with water and use it to clean surfaces such as countertops, sinks, and floors.

Create a DIY disinfectant spray using alcohol and essential oils: In the absence of commercial disinfectants, individuals can create their own disinfectant spray using alcohol and essential oils. A mixture of 70% isopropyl alcohol and 30% water can be used to kill bacteria and viruses on surfaces. To make the spray more effective, essential oils such as tea tree oil, lavender oil, and eucalyptus oil can be added to the mixture for their antibacterial properties.

Use baking soda as a natural abrasive cleaner: Baking soda is a natural abrasive that can be used to clean and remove dirt and grime from surfaces. When mixed with water, it creates a paste that can be used to scrub surfaces such as countertops, sinks, and floors. The abrasive properties of baking soda make it effective at removing tough stains and dirt, while its natural ingredients make it safe for use around pets and children.
